alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued May 13 at 3:22AM MDT until May 13 at 11:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...East winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Blowing dust possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds will occur below canyons on the east side of the Albuquerque metro area.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area
